VIET 361 Postwar Viet Nam in Literature, Media, and Film (5) I&S/VLPA
Explores how social and political changes in Vietnam since 1975 have made profound impacts upon the lives of Vietnamese people at home and abroad. Via literacy and visual genres, students learn to realize the critical relationship between utopian dreams and everyday realities while Vietnam rebuilt itself and re-integrated with the world.
View course details in MyPlan: VIET 361

VIET 311 Advanced Vietnamese (5) VLPA
Develops proficiency in reading, writing, listening, and speaking standard colloquial Vietnamese at an advanced level to prepare students to do research. Includes readings in fiction and nonfiction literature, vocabulary and grammar, writing comprehensive exercises, and topic-based conversations. First in a series of three.

VIET 212 Intermediate Vietnamese (5) VLPA
Development of conversation skills, reading for comprehension, and writing short compositions. Second in a sequence of three.

VIET 213 Intermediate Vietnamese (5) VLPA
Development of conversation skills, reading for comprehension, and writing short compositions. Third in a sequence of three.

VIET 211 Intermediate Vietnamese (5) VLPA
Development of conversation skills, reading for comprehension, and writing short compositions. First in a sequence of three.

VIET 145 Foreign Study: Elementary Vietnamese (1-15, max. 20)
For participants in study abroad programs who complete elementary language courses in approved programs in Vietnam. Evaluation by department faculty required.

VIET 496 Special Studies in Vietnamese (3-5, max. 15) VLPA Turner
Topics vary. Emphasizes improving language skills for research. Primarily for Southeast Asian studies majors. Offered: AWSp.

VIET 111 Elementary Vietnamese (5) Turner
Introduction to modern Vietnamese conversation. Emphasis on correct pronunciation, spelling, and sentence structure. Designed for students with no previous exposure to Vietnamese. First in a sequence of three. Offered: A.
View course details in MyPlan: VIET 111

VIET 499 Undergraduate Research (3-5, max. 15) Turner
Undergraduate research/independent study in Vietnamese language and literature. Offered: AWSp.
